thread.title: Bihar polls: BJP will win 32-34 seats in 1st phase, 22-24 seats in 2nd, says Amit Shah
thread.title_full: Bihar polls: BJP will win 32-34 seats in 1st phase, 22-24 seats in 2nd, says Amit Shah | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis

author: dna webdesk
title: Bihar polls: BJP will win 32-34 seats in 1st phase, 22-24 seats in 2nd, says Amit Shah
text:
PTI BJP President Amit Shah on Monday asserted that the party it will win 32-34 seats in 1st phase, 22-24 seats in 2nd phase of Bihar assembly polls. He also said that the party supported reservation for backward sections of the society.
“BJP has given many OBC CMs, we have even given an OBC PM. We support the backward, the poor,” he said.
On his assessment about NDA's performance in the first two phases of voting, Shah said, “In the first phase of polling we will win 32-34 seats, in second phase 22-24 seats.”
Shah further added, "We will focus on development when we come to power because, even today, Bihar is very backward when it comes to a several issues."
He also slammed 'Mahagathbandan'. "To take focus away from development agenda, some statements on beef or reservation are being highlighted," he said.
Attacking Nitish Kumar and Lalu Yadav, Shah said, "Bihar doesn't want to be a "BIMARU" state now. If Nitish ji comes back in the government then Lalu ji will run the government via a remote control."
He also refuted allegations that Sakshi Maharaj said that if BJP lost in Bihar, it would be Bihar's loss and not Narendra Modi's. Shah said, "He has not said any such thing. Show me the footage if you have."
